results.title: The Best Films and TV Shows to Stream Over the Holidays
results.abstract: Hollywood history (“Mank”), jazz (“Soul”) and romance (“Happiest Season”) all have a chance to shine in your living room as the year comes to an end.

results.title: John Belushi in Focus: What a New Film Gets Right and What It Misses
results.abstract: After Bob Woodward’s “Wired” focused too much on the comic’s death, this documentary looks fondly at the star’s life. But his comic genius deserves more.

results.title: A Film Festival in Poland Feted His Work. Now He May Face Prison There.
results.abstract: Matty Libatique, the celebrated, Oscar-nominated cinematographer, is to be tried in February on charges he assaulted a paramedic who responded when he collapsed at a Polish hotel.

results.abstract: Together 37 years but rarely paired onscreen, the real-life couple’s new Netflix holiday movie is an indication of how they — and Hollywood — have changed.

results.abstract: As the cold weather descends, warm your heart with a sports movie or get your blood pumping with suspenseful thrillers.

results.abstract: An Argentine who relocated to France, she drew acclaim with “A Very Curious Girl” and other films about female characters who empowered themselves.

results.abstract: In two books, she described Sammy Davis Jr.’s negligent parenting but also celebrated the intimate moments she shared with him toward the end of his life.
results.title: Tracey Davis, Chronicler of Ups and Downs With Her Famous Father, Dies at 59

results.abstract: “This is one of the best representations of a disabled character I’ve ever seen,” Allen said.

results.abstract: The new Showtime documentary aims to present a more complex view of John Belushi, the tragically fated star of “Animal House,” “The Blues Brothers” and “S.N.L.,” beyond the stunts and hard partying.
results.title: ‘Belushi’ Finds the Sensitive Man Inside the Wild Persona

multimedia.caption: “One of the important aspirations was to capture the lightness and the joy that John not only experienced but that he brought to the world,” said R.J. Cutler, the director of a new documentary about John Belushi.

results.title: A Canadian Town Is a Festive Anywhere, U.S.A., Onscreen

results.title: Anthony Hopkins Makes It Look Simple. (And Maybe It Should Be.)
